metadata.title: CVE-2023-1192 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in smb2_is_status_io_timeout() in CIFS inthe Linux Kernel. After CIFS transfers response data to a system call,there are still local variable points to the memory region, and if thesystem call frees it faster than CIFS uses it, CIFS will access a freememory region, leading to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-83-generic - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-5.15.0-83-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-83-generic - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-83-generic-64k - 5.15.0-83.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1041-kvm - 5.15.0-1041.46
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-83.92').
